Package infodynamics.measures.discrete

Class InfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.discrete.InfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConditionalMutualInformationCalculatorDiscrete, ContextOfPastMeasureCalculatorDiscrete, EntropyCalculatorDiscrete, MultiInformationCalculatorDiscrete, MultiVariateInfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete, MutualInformationCalculatorDiscrete
    public abstract class InfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete
extends java.lang.Object

    Base class for our information-theoretic calculators on discrete (int[]) data, providing common functionality for user-level measure classes.

    Usage of the child classes extending this class is intended to follow this paradigm:

    1. Construct the calculator;
    2. Initialise the calculator using initialise() or other initialise methods defined by child classes;
    3. Provide the observations/samples for the calculator to set up the PDFs, using one or more calls to sets of "addObservations" methods defined by child classes, then
    4. Compute the required quantities, being one or more of:
      • the average measure: computeAverageLocalOfObservations();
      • or other quantities as defined by child classes.
    5. Return to step 2 to re-use the calculator on a new data set.
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)

        the last computed measure value

      • getLastMax

        public double getLastMax()
        Return the last computed max local value of the measure. Not declaring this final so that separable calculator can throw an exception on it since it does not support it

      • getLastMin

        public double getLastMin()
        Return the last computed min local value of the measure. Not declaring this final so that separable calculator can throw an exception on it since it does not support it

      • getLastStd

        public final double getLastStd()
        Return the last computed standard deviation of local values of the measure.

      • getNumObservations

        public final int getNumObservations()
        Get the number of samples to be used for the PDFs here which have been supplied by calls to "setObservations", "addObservations" etc.

        Note that the number of samples may not be equal to the length of time-series supplied (e.g. for transfer entropy, where we need to accumulate a number of samples for the past history of the destination).

        Returns:
        the number of samples to be used for the PDFs

        Return whether a given integer is a power of 2
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        whether the integer is a power of 2

        Returns:
        the estimate of the measure
